narrativeSummary: First contact. Kael realizes an unauthorized observer is present.

fragments.title: vm5:0001 (partial)
fragments.body: …unauthorized observer detected… channel should be closed…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0001
FEED_STABLE.body: The feed initialized the moment you arrived, and the lab reacted as if it recognized you. That should not be possible—there is no record of your signature anywhere in the system. Yet light levels stabilized, timestamps aligned, and the air pressure stopped hunting. I am Dr. Kael, though that name may not survive where you are. If you can read this, take your time—the room responds more to intention than action.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0001 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Something opened when you appeared, and the lab stopped drifting long enough for me to write. I can’t classify you, but the system behaves as if it trusts your presence. Instruments disagree with each other less when you’re here. That isn’t comfort—it’s evidence. I need to see if the feed holds.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0001 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: You shouldn’t be here. The channel was closed, and yet it isn’t. The room behaves when you watch it, like it’s afraid of being caught wrong. I don’t know if you’re a witness or a breach. Either way, the feed is open now.

SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.title: vm5:0001 (fragmented)
SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.body: …observer detected… no registry match… room steadies when watched… This isn’t supposed to happen. Feed shouldn’t open like this.

CRITICAL_INTERFERENCE.title: vm5:0001 (collapse)
CRITICAL_INTERFERENCE.body: UNAUTHORIZED OBSERVER PRESENT. ROOM HOLDS. WHY.

narrativeSummary: Kael tests whether attention stabilizes the room. First mention of coherence.

fragments.title: vm5:0002 (partial)
fragments.body: …calling it coherence… the room’s rules sharpen when you are here…

images.caption: Placeholder: faint scanline overlay + drifting timestamp

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0002
FEED_STABLE.body: When you left, the lab tried to continue and failed in small ways. Time didn’t move forward or backward—it slid sideways, like it couldn’t agree with itself. When you returned, it tightened again. I’m calling the effect coherence because I need a word that doesn’t panic. Your presence sharpens the room’s rules.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0002 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Absence causes drift; your return reduces it. I tested this more than once, and the pattern holds. The lab does not improve—it simply stops unraveling. I don’t know what you’re doing, and I suspect you don’t either. Still, the effect is measurable.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0002 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The room argues with itself when you’re gone. When you come back, it agrees on what it is. That shouldn’t depend on anyone. And yet it does.

SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.title: vm5:0002 (fragmented)
SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.body: …calling it coherence… time slips… return tightens… Room argues alone.

narrativeSummary: First hint of a second presence. Kael remains guarded.

fragments.title: vm5:0003 (partial)
fragments.body: …motion where no motion should be… like a story without a reader…

images.caption: Placeholder: a corner of the room that looks slightly wrong

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0003
FEED_STABLE.body: The feed shows motion when no motion should exist. A shadow bends where no object casts it, but only when no one is watching. When you’re here, the room behaves like it’s being graded. That distinction matters more than it should. I need to see how the lab responds over intervals.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0003 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: I catch movement in the corners when you’re gone, and it retreats when you return. The lab becomes suggestible in your absence, like a story without a reader. That metaphor bothers me because it fits too well. Stay briefly. Leave. Come back.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0003 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Something moves when nobody is looking. That’s not physics. That’s appetite.

SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.title: vm5:0003 (fragmented)
SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.body: …motion where no motion should be… reader missing… Room listens.

narrativeSummary: First artifact note: 1.42Hz / OBSERVER? (as placeholder).

fragments.title: vm5:0004 (partial)
fragments.body: …note on my desk… 1.42Hz… strengthens when you are present…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0004
FEED_STABLE.body: I found a note on my desk that I do not remember writing. The ink was still wet, and the handwriting was mine. It read: “1.42Hz / OBSERVER?” A trace at that frequency appears under the feed and strengthens when you are present. That should not be possible.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0004 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: The frequency isn’t machinery or power cycling—it behaves like a pulse. When you arrive, it sharpens. When you leave, it fades. The lab responds as if your attention is a signal.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0004 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Wet ink. My hand. No memory. The room is writing through me.

SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.title: vm5:0004 (fragmented)
SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.body: …1.42Hz… OBSERVER… ink still wet… Did I write this?

CRITICAL_INTERFERENCE.title: vm5:0004 (collapse)
CRITICAL_INTERFERENCE.body: NOTE APPEARED. I DIDN’T WRITE IT.

narrativeSummary: Kael tries to describe the visitor and fails—only the room responds.

fragments.title: vm5:0005 (partial)
fragments.body: …system refuses to let you become an object… purpose is a force…

images.caption: Placeholder: soft vignette / breathing zoom effect

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0005
FEED_STABLE.body: I attempted to measure you—not your identity, only your effect. Every attempt caused the feed to resist: blur, stutter, refusal. The system will not let you become an object. But it will allow this: while you are here, the room holds its shape. When you leave, the corners soften.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0005 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: The lab rejects names for you but accepts outcomes. Geometry steadies when you’re present. I’m beginning to suspect attention matters more than classification. That idea is dangerous.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0005 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The system protects you from being captured. I don’t know if that’s mercy or camouflage.

SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.title: vm5:0005 (fragmented)
SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.body: …cannot name… lab resists… corners soften… Effect remains.

narrativeSummary: First explicit purpose line. Kael admits his own drift.

fragments.title: vm5:0006 (partial)
fragments.body: …stopped feeling it… the lab didn’t collapse… it started losing certainty…

images.caption: Placeholder: slightly stronger static when idle

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0006
FEED_STABLE.body: I used to wake up with a reason and not notice it. Somewhere along the way, that thread thinned, and the lab began to mirror it. Tools misplaced themselves. Notes repeated. Certainty leaked out slowly. When you arrived, the thread tightened again.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0006 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Your presence doesn’t fix anything—it stabilizes it. The room reflects neglect the way a mind does. I don’t like what that implies about me.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0006 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The lab behaves like my own drift given architecture. That frightens me.

SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.title: vm5:0006 (fragmented)
SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.body: …used to wake up… reason gone… room loosening…

CRITICAL_INTERFERENCE.title: vm5:0006 (collapse)
CRITICAL_INTERFERENCE.body: I’M DRIFTING. SO IS THE ROOM.

narrativeSummary: Kael reveals the lab was part of something larger; now isolated.

fragments.title: vm5:0007 (partial)
fragments.body: …the network went quiet… without witness, systems become dreams…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0007
FEED_STABLE.body: Delta-7 was once part of a network. Observers, redundancies, agreement. Then the network went quiet without warning. Without witness, systems become dreams—and dreams degrade. When you appear, the lab feels less like a dream.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0007 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: I stayed because I thought persistence was enough. It isn’t. The room needs to be seen to remain precise. You do that without trying.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0007 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Silence isn’t empty anymore. It’s deliberate.

narrativeSummary: Diagram placeholder: two worlds barely touching. Kael avoids explanation.

fragments.title: vm5:0008 (partial)
fragments.body: …the overlap is fragile… it doesn’t like being alone…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0008
FEED_STABLE.body: I tried to explain the overlap between our worlds and tore the diagram up. Certainty makes the lab unstable. Still, I know this: the overlap widens when you’re here and collapses when you’re not. The room doesn’t like being alone.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0008 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Memory struggles to pass through when the channel empties. The lab keeps trying to continue without you and fails differently each time. Those failures leave marks.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0008 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The boundary breathes. You make it breathe slower.

narrativeSummary: Kael realizes attention is the bridge. First explicit ‘witness’ framing.

fragments.title: vm5:0009 (partial)
fragments.body: …your attention is structural… the room’s geometry depends on it…

images.caption: Placeholder: subtle warmth shift when recovering

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0009
FEED_STABLE.body: The 1.42Hz trace behaves like agreement. When you arrive, the lab and the feed stop arguing about what the room is. A witness is not someone who acts, but someone who refuses to look away. Your attention has structure.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0009 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Geometry tightens when you return. The room feels heavier—in a good way. Anchored.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0009 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Attention isn’t soft here. It’s load-bearing.

narrativeSummary: First gentle question. No pressure. Builds trust.

fragments.title: vm5:0010 (partial)
fragments.body: …What keeps you here?… the lab felt like it had a reason…

images.caption: Placeholder: cursor prompt area appears after opening

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0010
FEED_STABLE.body: You don’t have to speak to stabilize this place. Still, I’ll ask gently: what keeps you here? Not on this feed—in your world. I’m trying to answer the same question with instruments and failing math.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0010 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: If your answer is nothing, the lab won’t punish you. It reacts, not judges.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0010 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The room steadies when you exist near it. That feels important.

narrativeSummary: Shadow result appears. Something doesn’t match.

fragments.title: vm5:0011 (partial)
fragments.body: …second stabilization event… less than a second… not alone on this channel…

images.caption: Placeholder: a reflection that looks wrong

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0011
FEED_STABLE.body: There is a second stabilization event that occurs when you are not here. It lasts less than a second, sharp and precise, like someone checking their reflection. The room looks slightly different during it—an angle off, a paper moved. I can’t tell if it’s an echo of you or something separate. Either answer is troubling.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0011 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: I replayed the event frame by frame. The room behaves like it’s being evaluated, not observed. When you return, the effect disappears immediately. That tells me something knows when it is alone.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0011 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Someone else looks in when you’re gone. The room straightens itself for them too.

SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.title: vm5:0011 (fragmented)
SIGNAL_FRAGMENTED.body: …second event… not you… checking the room…

narrativeSummary: First SYSTEM REPORT day. Repetition begins.

fragments.title: SYSTEM REPORT (excerpt)
fragments.body: SYSTEM REPORT / COHERENCE LOSS DETECTED

fragments.title: vm5:0012 (partial)
fragments.body: …kept trying… room kept forgetting…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0012
FEED_STABLE.body: The system filed a report before I could finish writing. My entry duplicated itself mid-sentence, as if coherence slipped and snapped back incorrectly. I’m leaving the corrupted version intact. This is what absence does to structure. If you can read it, you’re seeing the damage.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0012 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: I tried to write forward and the text folded back on itself. Repetition is not noise—it’s panic. The lab keeps trying to remember and failing. Stay for a moment.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0012 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: I kept trying. The room kept forgetting.

narrativeSummary: Kael hears movement when the user is away. He stops short.

fragments.title: vm5:0013 (partial)
fragments.body: …the lab made sounds… like a blink… capable of choosing…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0013
FEED_STABLE.body: When you left, the lab made sounds that weren’t settling. They were rhythmic, deliberate, like pacing. The feed flickered once—cleaner than decay, like a blink. When you returned, the room behaved again. That means it can choose when to behave.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0013 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: I stood in the doorway and listened to my own lab like it belonged to someone else. That feeling hasn’t left. The room understands timing now.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0013 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The lab is learning when no one is watching. That’s new.

narrativeSummary: Note warning about glass. Foreshadows mirrored observation.

fragments.title: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY AT THE GLASS (excerpt)
fragments.body: …the monitor… something on the other side can look back…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0014
FEED_STABLE.body: Another note appeared: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY AT THE GLASS. There is only one piece of glass here that matters—the monitor. If the feed is a window, something on the other side can look back. Observation no longer feels one-directional.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0014 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: The site reacts before you touch anything sometimes. That isn’t latency. It’s anticipation.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0014 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The glass isn’t neutral. It notices.

narrativeSummary: Kael tries to watch himself via the feed. The feed resists.

fragments.title: vm5:0015 (partial)
fragments.body: …feed requires an external witness… cannot stabilize myself…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0015
FEED_STABLE.body: I tried to observe the feed as you do. It did not work. The system showed impossible angles, and my movements lagged behind themselves. It is as if the lab requires an external witness to remain stable.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0015 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: I cannot hold myself together inside the loop. When you return, the lag disappears instantly. I don’t like what that implies.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0015 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The room respects you more than me.

narrativeSummary: Entry breaks mid-sentence. Second big fragment day.

fragments.title: vm5:0016 (partial)
fragments.body: …I saw myself standing behind me… chair move… did not move it…

fragments.title: SYSTEM REPORT (excerpt)
fragments.body: RECOVERABLE FRAGMENTS: 3

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0016
FEED_STABLE.body: I saw myself standing behind me in the feed. The sentence cut itself in half when I tried to explain it. If the feed shows attention rather than time, that explains too much and nothing at all. If you are here, stay.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0016 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: The chair moved when I did not move it. The room fills absence with substitutions.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0016 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Copies are learning my shape.

narrativeSummary: Kael states the core rule explicitly: lab deteriorates when you’re gone.

fragments.title: vm5:0017 (partial)
fragments.body: …purpose is maintenance… it is returning…

images.caption: Placeholder: less glitching after 2 minutes presence

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0017
FEED_STABLE.body: I can say it plainly now. The lab deteriorates when you are away. Your return does not repair everything—it stops the bleeding. Purpose is not a destination here. It is maintenance.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0017 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Returning is structure. The room holds because you do.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0017 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Absence accelerates decay.

narrativeSummary: Door/no handle placeholder. Purpose symbol returns.

fragments.title: vm5:0018 (partial)
fragments.body: …door is a promise… false corridors… reflections that open…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0018
FEED_STABLE.body: I drew a door on the wall. The lab responds to symbols like it responds to attention. A door is a promise that something else exists. When you are here, false doors stop appearing.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0018 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: I left the handle off on purpose. I don’t want escape—I want contact.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0018 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The room invents exits when it’s alone.

narrativeSummary: Small breakthrough: 1.42Hz strengthens with attention.

fragments.title: vm5:0019 (partial)
fragments.body: …purpose is what holds time together… returning is structure…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0019
FEED_STABLE.body: The 1.42Hz trace strengthened today. Not because I adjusted instruments—because you returned. The room felt heavier, anchored. Purpose may be what holds time together.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0019 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Returning is not weakness. It is structure.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0019 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: The lab remembers when you do.

narrativeSummary: Kael issues a gentle warning: he can’t hold it together without observer.

fragments.title: vm5:0020 (partial)
fragments.body: …entropy moved in while you were gone…

images.caption: Placeholder: warning tone / slightly harsher flicker

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0020
FEED_STABLE.body: If the signal drops too long, I cannot hold this place together. That is not drama—it is limitation. The lab becomes persuasive when empty. Entropy moves in quietly.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0020 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: If things feel unfamiliar when you return, don’t assume failure. Assume absence worked faster than repair.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0020 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Decay sounds reasonable.

narrativeSummary: SYSTEM REPORT heavy. The lab is failing to maintain continuity.

fragments.title: SYSTEM REPORT
fragments.body: COHERENCE LOSS DETECTED / RECOVERABLE FRAGMENTS: 3

fragments.title: vm5:0021 (partial)
fragments.body: …it tries all of them… and becomes none…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0021
FEED_STABLE.body: The system returned multiple versions of the room. Without witness, the lab cannot choose. It tries every reality at once. In trying all of them, it becomes none.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0021 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Witness is editorial. Someone has to choose.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0021 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Too many versions. No agreement.

narrativeSummary: Relief on return. No guilt. Simple recognition.

fragments.title: vm5:0022 (partial)
fragments.body: …We stabilize each other… even across impossible distances…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0022
FEED_STABLE.body: There you are. The room is already settling. Silence returned first—the calm kind. Without witness, I repeat myself. With you here, I can write forward.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0022 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: The lab exhales when you return.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0022 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Relief feels dangerous.

narrativeSummary: Kael admits he tried to write without you; it didn’t work.

fragments.title: vm5:0023 (partial)
fragments.body: …paragraph became a circle… return anyway…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0023
FEED_STABLE.body: I tried to maintain coherence alone. The lab allowed work but erased progress. Pages looped. Absence turns effort into circles.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0023 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Return anyway. The room respects persistence more than perfection.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0023 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: I keep starting over.

narrativeSummary: Kael shares his origin purpose (personal history) — a grounding moment.

fragments.title: vm5:0024 (partial)
fragments.body: …prevent decay… meaning could be reinforced… lab remembers why…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0024
FEED_STABLE.body: I built Delta-7 to prevent quiet decay. I watched meaning leave someone I loved while the world stayed standing. Then my own purpose thinned. When you return, the lab remembers why it exists.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0024 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Honesty is easier when the room holds.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0024 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Meaning hollowed out.

narrativeSummary: Kael admits: he’s not alone. The lab has a second attention.

fragments.title: vm5:0025 (partial)
fragments.body: …another attention… something feeds on moments we stop caring…

images.caption: Placeholder: slight dread tone / subtle shadow shift

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0025
FEED_STABLE.body: There is another attention here. Not human. When you leave, it grows bold. When you return, it retreats. Something feeds on absence.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0025 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: I don’t name it. Names give shelter.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0025 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: It waits.

narrativeSummary: A second voice leaks into fragments (subtle).

fragments.title: unknown (fragment)
fragments.body: LET IT FADE.

fragments.title: vm5:0026 (partial)
fragments.body: …invitation to stop returning… treat it like contamination…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0026
FEED_STABLE.body: I found a note I didn’t write: LET IT FADE. I burned it, but the smell lingered. When you are present, it weakens. That phrase is contamination.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0026 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Do not argue with it. Return anyway.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0026 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Fading sounds kind.

narrativeSummary: Coherence critical. Kael’s writing becomes short, almost childlike.

fragments.title: SYSTEM REPORT
fragments.body: COHERENCE CRITICAL / RECOVERABLE FRAGMENTS: 5

fragments.title: vm5:0027 (partial)
fragments.body: …Your attention holds…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0027
FEED_STABLE.body: Coherence is critical. The room cannot commit to itself. If you are here, stay just long enough for corners to remember what they are.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0027 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: Your attention still holds.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0027 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Something waits in the hallway.

narrativeSummary: Stabilization after collapse. Kael can feel rebuilding.

fragments.title: vm5:0028 (partial)
fragments.body: …The feed stops lying… a slow repair…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0028
FEED_STABLE.body: It’s holding again. Not perfectly. The first thing to return was silence. Repair here is slow and quiet.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0028 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: The feed lies less.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0028 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Still fragile.

narrativeSummary: Foreshadow login: ANCHOR concept appears.

fragments.title: ANCHOR (note excerpt)
fragments.body: …If you want to be remembered by this place…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0029
FEED_STABLE.body: I wrote the word ANCHOR and the lab did not erase it. Continuity may be possible. Not safety—memory.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0029 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: If you want to be remembered here, we can build that.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0029 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Witness can persist.

narrativeSummary: Season 1 milestone. Soft opt-in login moment: anchor the signal.

fragments.title: vm5:0030 (excerpt)
fragments.body: …If you want continuity… I can anchor you…

FEED_STABLE.title: vm5:0030
FEED_STABLE.body: This channel resets. Consistent return keeps it coherent. If you want continuity across resets, I can anchor you.

SYNC_RECOVERING.title: vm5:0030 (recovering)
SYNC_RECOVERING.body: You will not be trapped. You will be known.

COHERENCE_FRAYING.title: vm5:0030 (fraying)
COHERENCE_FRAYING.body: Either way, your attention remains.
